General Corrosion.unacceptable:
1. Prevent corrosion through adjusting the index by 
a. Reducing the saturation pH (e.g. by increasing alkalinity) or 
b. Increasing the pH (through alkali addition), or 
c. Increasing CaCO3 concentration by concentrating the stream  (through evaporation or reverse osmosis) and adjusting pH, or by adding calcium or alkalinity or both.
2. Combat corrosion by employing corrosion inhibitors.
3. Tolerate corrosive conditions by changing construction material.
General Corrosion.acceptable: Maintain monitoring, and be ready to take action should index increase.

Pitting Corrosion.unacceptable:
Treatment recommended - 
1. Consider a higher PREN alloy for use
2. Combat corrosion by employing corrosion inhibitors.
3. Tolerate corrosive conditions by changing construction material.

General Corrosion.unacceptable:
1.Prevent scaling through adjusting the index by 
a. Increasing the saturation pH (e.g. by reducing alkalinity) or 
b. By decreasing the pH (through acid addition), or 
c. By decreasing CaCO3 concentration by diluting the stream  (through reducing concentration cycles, if applicable) and adjusting pH, or by removing calcium (softening - chemical, ion exchange or nano-filtration) or alkalinity (de-alkalation through acidification, chemical porecipitation, nono-filtration) or both.
2. Combat scaling by employing scale inhibitors.

Silica Concentration in steam.tolerable:
1.  Prevent scale formation by treating feedwater to remove silica (Anion Exchange, Electrodeionisation)
2.  Use scale inhibitors to combate scale formation

Silica and Magnesium.unacceptable:
If unacceptable: 
1.  Prevent scale formation by 
a.  Reducing Magnesium concentration (through  chemical precipitation, ion exchange, nano-filtration) 
b.  Reducing silica concentration (through chemical precipitation, eg with Alum) or ion exchange.
c.  Dilution (normally not the preferred way) OR
2.   Combat scaling through addition of scale inhibitor

calcium sulphate.unacceptable:
If unacceptable: 
1. Prevent scale formation by 
a. Reducing Calcium concentration (through  chemical precipitation, ion exchange, nano-filtration) 
b. Reducing sulphate concentration (through chemical precipitation, eg with Lime or ion exchange or nano-filtration).
c. Dilution (normally not the preferred way) or
2. Combat scaling through addition of scale inhibitor
